channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road /parking being intentionally blocked, 26th August
item.description:
The resident of 213 blithdale Road is regularly putting both of their wheely bins in the road outside of their house to stop others from parking in the bays. This is on street parking for residents only, they should not be blocking the road and intentionally preventing others from parking on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree, leaf and acorn debris, 26th August
item.description:
There is vegetation hanging over and jutting through the new railings plus droppings from the trees, leaves and acorns etc are all the way along the footpath. With the added issue of roadworks commencing 1st September to 6th December in Sandy Lane this could cause an issue especially as the weather turns. One of our ladies slipped on the acorns this morning, so imagine in wet weather it would cause additional risks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Untaxed Vehicles, 26th August
item.description:
Two untaxed vehicles that are not registered SORN have been dumped in the parking area of Haldane Road for the past month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haldane Road, London

item.title: Bent Parking Sign, 26th August
item.description:
Bent parking sign caused a significant injury to an elderly lady. She walked into it and the bent angle means the sign was able to hit her head and caused a gash that bled heavily. Patient fine, treated in a local pharmacy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Hill, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate bins leading to animal problen, 26th August
item.description:
These bins belong to johnnies cafe, 135 lordship lane. This is the appearance one week before these bins are to be collected. Firstly the bin size is far too small for the business and this leads to overflowing and then along come foxes and rats. Second these bins are just dumped on the street. A single large bin or some better solution is needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Hansler Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Updates residence,Leaseholders,tenants,family,friends,visitors,football fans, you're authority Hackney Council London borough of hackney have made Osborne Road garages free parking for everyone no parking tickets, no enforcement at Osborne Road garages no need to buy E permits or book vouchers because the parking is free for everyone 24/7 Hackney council's new policy free parking marvelous causing ASB. Shame they don't make the whole of Hackney like this free parking only when it suits them., 26th August

item.title: Wall been knocked down, this is a health and safety risk, 26th August
item.description:
This wall has been left in this condition for weeks. Apparently the refuge collection for bins backed into it but never been repaired since.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pritchards Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish Dumped In Park, 26th August
item.description:
Cardboard box dumped in park area. Hopefully, the address label on the box will now allow Peabody to crack down on this continuous problem. Alternatively, pass it on to RBG to bring these people to task.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
